explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_solids.rationale: Non-combustible (BGIA, GESTIS-database on hazardous substancess, Accessed in 2006)

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Non-combustible (BGIA, GESTIS-database on hazardous substancess, Accessed in 2006)

self_heating_substances.rationale: Non-combustible (BGIA, GESTIS-database on hazardous substancess, accessed in 2006)

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Category 2 based on SPECIES: Rat; ENDPOINT: LD50; VALUE: 42mg/kg; REFERENCE SOURCE: EHC 224 (2001)

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: It was set as Category 2 based on rat LD50 = 150mg/kg (RTECS, 2004).

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: It was set as Category 2 from description of "which indicates stimulant to the skin" on Chemical Safety Data Sheets Vol.4 a/The Royal Society of Chemistry (1991) equivalent to Priority 2. Moreover, SITTIG (47th, 2002) has description of "irritation may be indicated in the skin, an eye, and membrane."

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: There is the description that the similar descriptions in humans "(may) irritates to skin, eye, and membrane" (SITTIG (4th, 2002) of Priority 2 and Chemical Safety Data Sheets Vol.4 a/The Royal Society of Chemistry (1991) equivalent to Priority 2). So it was classified into Category 2. It is difficult to subdivide the Category 2A and 2B. [Indication] 2A is recommended based on the safety, when the Category needs to subdivide.

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitization: Classification not possible; Skin sensitization: Not classified
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory sensitization: no data available. Skin sensitization : from the description "development of the skin sensitization of inorganic arsenic is rare" in the humans of EHC 224 (2001) of Priority 1, and it was negative in maximization test of the guinea pig, it carried out the outside of Category.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.hazard_statement: Suspected of causing genetic defects (state route of exposure if it is conclusively proven that no other routes of exposure cause the hazard)
germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Although there is two or more knowledge which induces micronucleus/chromosome aberration in the in vivo mouse marrow from description of EHC 224 (2001), it is negative in the mouse dominant lethal tests. So it is set as 2.

carcinogenicity.hazard_statement: May cause cancer (state route of exposure if it is conclusively proven that no other routes of exposure cause the hazard)
carcinogenicity.rationale: Since all existing classified materials in IARC Suppl.7 (1987), ACGHI-TLV (2004), and MAK/BAT (2004) are categorized into human carcinogens (as arsenic and arsenic cmpds), it was classified into Category 1A.

toxic_to_reproduction.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the undorn child
toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: It was considered as Category 2 from the description about the humans of EHC 224 (2001) of Priority 1 "effect on reproductive is suggested" and knowledge in animal "fetus toxicity and teratogenicity at the dosage in which maternal toxicity is observed " and the description in the humans of Catalog of teratogenic agents (2004) equivalent to Priority 1"the conclusion that inorganic arsenic is not teratogen in humans is supported."

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.classification: Category 1 (digestive system, cardiovascular system, nervous system, blood system, kidneys); Category 3 (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs (digestive system, cardiovascular system, nervous system, blood system, kidneys); May cause respiratory irritation or may cause drowsiness and dizziness (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: The substance was classified as Category 1 (gastrointestinal system, cardio-vascular system, nervous system, blood system and kidneys) and Category 3 (airway irritant). Based on the report that in the forms of the arsenic and inorganic arsenic compounds it causes "symptoms in the gastrointestinal organs, disorders in the functions of the cardio-vascular and nervous systems, myelosuppression, alteration in the blood system and nephropathy" in humans (EHC 224 (2001)), and based on a similar report in PIM (Poisons Information Monographs) G042 (WHO/IPCS, 1996), and as well as the reports of "airway irritant properties" in PIM (Poisons Information Monographs) G042 (WHO/IPCS, 1996) and HSG (Health and Safety Guides) 70 (WHO/IPCS, 1992).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.classification: Category 1 (digestive system, nervous system, blood system, cardiovascular system, kidneys, liver, skin)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Causes damage to organs (digestive system, nervous system, blood system, cardiovascular system, kidneys, liver, skin) through prolonged or repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the description in the humans of arsenic and inorganic arsenics compounds, "gastrointestinal disturbances, neuropathy, effect on blood systems, and disorders on cardiovascular systems, kidney, and liver were observed the long term administration of inorganic arsenic. Target organ are gastrointestinal,heart,brains and kidney. The skin, marrow and peripheral nervous systems are also affected " (EHC 224 (2001), and PIM(Poisons Information Monographs) G042 (WHO/IPCS, 1996)), it was classified into Category 1 (a digestive tract, a nervous systems, blood systems, the kidney, liver, respiratory system, skin)

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 96-hour EC50=78.7microg/L of algae (Scenedesmus) (AQUIRE, 2003).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 1, since acute toxicity was Category 1, and it is a metallic compound, behavior in water and bioaccumulative potential are unknown.
